info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 21 at 8:41PM EDT by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT NORTHEASTERN VENANGO... NORTHWESTERN JEFFERSON...CENTRAL ARMSTRONG...CLARION AND FOREST COUNTIES THROUGH 915 PM EDT... At 841 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 6 miles east of Enterprise to near Rimersburg. Movement was northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Clarion, Brookville, Marienville, Knox, Rimersburg, New Bethlehem, Tionesta, East Brady, Sligo, Strattanville, Summerville, and Limestone. This includes Interstate 80 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 52 and 84. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM EDT for northwestern Pennsylvania.
